commText: Harshal Patel to Mishra, B0$ Caught by Karthik!! How did that go behind the wicket to the keeper? Anyway RCB have wrapped this up! Slower ball floated up at the stumps, Mishra looks for a lofted drive down the ground, mistimes it so horribly that it goes behind him, giving Karthik a simple catch. B1$

formatValue: Mishra c Karthik b Harshal Patel 19(30) [4s-2]

commText: Harshal Patel to Mishra, B0$, low full toss at the stumps, Mishra shuffles across and scoops it over short fine

Hazlewood to Naveen-ul-Haq, B0$ Caught by Karthik!! That shoud be it! Oh wait, Rahul is coming out to bat! Not over yet! This is short outside off, Naveen-ul-Haq tries a ramp but nicks it to the keeper B1$

Hazlewood to Naveen-ul-Haq, B0$, no way there's life in this game yet, is there? Hazlewood goes for a yorker outside off, Naveen-ul-Haq tries a reverse-scoop, aims towards third man and somehow gets it to fine leg

Harshal Patel to Naveen-ul-Haq, B0$, is that a six? Nope. Bounced just in front. Naveen-ul-Haq advances down the track, slaps the back of a length delivery up and over extra cover and gets decent connection on it

Siraj to Naveen-ul-Haq, B0$, given as no-ball by the square leg umpire for being the second bouncer of the over. Faf has reviewed. Banged in short, Naveen-ul-Haq ducks but it would've surely been over his shoulder in his upright stance. The decision is upheld. Free hit coming up
Siraj to Mishra, 1 run, pitched up on middle, Mishra flicks to midwicket and scampers for a single. He's safely home by the time the stumps are broken

Siraj to Mishra, B0$, smart from RCB to have the third man very fine, but Harshal fails to cut it off despite getting to it. Siraj not happy. Short of length outside off, Mishra goes hard and it flies off the edge past DK. Harshal slides across, and it deflects off his thigh into the ropes

Lomror to Ravi Bishnoi, B0$ Ravi Bishnoi Run Out!! 1 run completed. Another run out. Bishnoi gone trying to take a second, and LSG are eight down! It was reverse-swept to backward point, the fielder puts down a difficult chance over his head and it trickles away behind him. Bishnoi thinks two is on, but Harshal, who was at short third, retrieves the ball and fires it to Karthik who breaks the stumps. Bishnoi well short despite a dive. B1$

Harshal Patel to Gowtham, B0$ Gowtham Run Out!! 1 run completed. A run-out appeal has been referred to the third umpire. Oh he's gone! Gowtham was batting so well, but he's been run out! What a breakthrough! Could well be the game! Good length outside off, Gowtham pushes it through backward point and runs hard. It's tight on the second run with the fielder charging across, but Gowtham risks it. And he pays. That was brilliant from Sonu Yadav who attacked the ball and released a flat throw on the bounce to DK. B1$

Karn Sharma to Stoinis, B0$ Caught by Prabhudessai!! Sliced in the air, and taken! Stoinis gone! This is a big one for RCB! Again Karn floats the leg-break wide outside off, Stoinis is tempted to go after it, goes for a big lofted shot but there's turn for Karn. The ball grips and catches the outside half. It's well taken by Prabhudessai running to his left at long-off. B1$

formatValue: Stoinis c Prabhudessai b Karn Sharma 13(19) [6s-1]

commText: Karn Sharma to Gowtham, 1 run, B0$! Difficult chance, was a healthy deflection. Karn tosses this leg-break quite wide outside off, Gowtham throws his hands at it but the ball grips to take the edge

formatValue: edged and Karthik can't hold on

commText: Hasaranga to Gowtham, B0$, Virat is not happy with this. He was at long-on and soon as he saw the ball sail over him, he had a few words to say to Hasaranga. Perhaps suggesting why would you toss it up so full? It was right in the arc for Krishnappa Gowtham and he's unleashed those long levers to send it soaring over the sightscreen
Karn Sharma to Gowtham, B0$, and now bowls a full delivery down leg, Gowtham sinks to one knee and helps it away with a neat paddle past the keeper to his left
Karn Sharma to Gowtham, B0$, rank long hop and Krishnappa Gowtham takes full toll of it. Quick to jump back inside the crease and pulls it for a B1$ over deep square

Karn Sharma to Pooran, B0$ Caught by Lomror!! This was coming. Right from ball one you could sense that Pooran was here to try and counter attack and had absolutely no intentions of hanging around. He picked the right ball but just didn't get the desired timing. Picked the legbreak from outside leg and got too much height than distance on the slogsweep. Lomror at deep square runs across to his right and puts in a dive to complete the catch. Half the side back in the hut for the home side. B1$

formatValue: Pooran c Lomror b Karn Sharma 9(7) [6s-1]

commText: Hasaranga to Pooran, B0$, sighters, what sighters says Nicholas Pooran. He winds up for a full delivery and smokes it into the cow corner stands with a clean swing of the bat

Hasaranga to Hooda, B0$ Stumped!! Hooda could believe what he just saw on the big screen. To be fair, he had an air of guilt surrounding him soon as the umpire took it upstairs. He perhaps knew? It was the the gentle legbreak from Hasaranga, managed to beat the prodding blade of Hooda. Beat the outside edge and got the ball to skid at a nice height to DK. Hooda was prodding a little too much and couldn't get his back foot inside in the nick of time. It was just on the line when the bails came off. B1$

Hazlewood to Stoinis, B0$, I0$ they call him in the Big Bash. He very well knew Hazlewood's go-to lengths. Just stood back, waited for the back of a length delivery to arrive and thwacks it flat and straight back over the bowler's head

Hazlewood to Ayush Badoni, B0$ Caught by Kohli!! It's Kohli again. He blows a kiss to someone after taking that catch. Hazlewood got Badoni dancing to his tunes in the first over and perhaps got into his head. He switched ends and bowled this a touch fuller than the good length. Badoni's eyes lit up and he didn't bother to press forward, just a slap drive and it has been intercepted by a leaping VK at cover. Came off the toe end and Kohli leapt to his fullest before grabbing it over his head. B1$

formatValue: Ayush Badoni c Kohli b Hazlewood 4(11)

commText: Maxwell to Krunal Pandya, B0$ Caught by Kohli!! Maxi strikes. He fired this wide and didn't offer too much pace on it, Krunal came shuffling down the track and looked for an inside out loft. Just relied on timing and didn't bother to exert any power on that. Chips it off the bottom half of the bat and Kohli completes a fine catch running back and to his right at long-off. B1$

formatValue: Krunal Pandya c Kohli b Maxwell 14(11) [4s-3]

commText: Siraj to Krunal Pandya, B0$, three in a row! Siraj loads it too full and Krunal just lifts it back over the bowler's head to claim his third successive boundary

Siraj to Krunal Pandya, B0$, gee, these powerplay runs are gold! Absolutely crucial. I0$ full outside off, Krunal makes room and slams the drive inside out over extra cover, Kohli gives chase but ball wins the race
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, B0$, a little too short and Krunal says thank you. The ball arrives nicely onto the hip and Krunal swivels before depositing the pull over mid-wicket

Siraj to Mayers, B0$ Caught by Anuj Rawat!! B1$ Mayers looks to bash this over the infield but lack of bounce on this skiddy length delivery meant he skewed it off the thick inside half and towards the bottom half of the bat. Anuj backpedals and claims the catch over his head with an air of calmness. B2$

formatValue: Out for a third-ball duck in Bengaluru and now out for a second-ball duck. Both times it is Mohammed Siraj.
Mayers c Anuj Rawat b Siraj 0(2)
